action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the sandwich in the freezer, the plate on the shelf and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a refrigerator and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a banana, a orange, a apple, a peach and a sandwich.
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich and a pillow.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a broom closet now. There are a broom and a mop. The broom is on the floor. The mop is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'remove' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'leave' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'discard' action.
You can't see a floor here.
You can't see a floor here.
You can't see a wardrobe here.
You can't go to a bedroom from here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.
I don't know what 'pillow inside' means.
You put the pillow in the wardrobe.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a broom closet now. There are a broom and a mop. The broom is on the floor. The mop is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You take the mop. In your inventory you have a mop and a sandwich.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a refrigerator and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a chair, a side table, a shelf and a couch. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't see a counter here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a refrigerator and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You put the sandwich on the counter.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a chair, a side table, a shelf and a couch. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a mop and a book.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a sandwich, a refrigerator and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The sandwich is on the counter. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't see a shelf here.
